description: 1817, from Ancient Greek Καδμεία (Kadmeía, “calamine”), a cadmium-bearing mixture of minerals, which was named after the king Κάδμος (Kádmos, “Cadmus”).

entries.meaning: A chemical element (symbol Cd) with an atomic number of 48: a soft, silvery-white metal.
(countable) A single atom of this element.
